Peter and Paul, the soldiers struggled greatly in the apostolic battle with great effort! Peter and Paul truly endured many toils and great immeasurable suffering. Our father Peter completed [the struggle] by the death of the cross in the great city of Rome for the sake of the name of Jesus Christ. They crucified him with his head inverted down. And thus, he gave up his soul with joy and delight. And so also Paul, in Rome, there they severed his head by (order of) Nero the king. And they reposed with Him in His everlasting kingdom forever, in life everlasting and persistent joy. May we the faithful complete their commemoration with great joy, with happiness, and without sadness.

He relied on Jesus Christ until he received the crown of martyrdom. Proconius refused the glory of this world for the gift of Jesus Christ. He angered Diocletian the king, and followed Christ, the King of the heavens and earth. He left the soldiery behind him and thus was counted among the martyrs. Truly, this struggler fulfilled the commandments of the gospel and rejected the world and all its wealth, and followed the hope that is in Jesus Christ. He unfastened the belt of soldiery and girded himself as a soldier of the King of heaven and earth. He rejected the crown of the hypocrite kings, and thus received the heavenly crown.

Much is the suffering which this saint bore, and many are the honors which Christ granted to him. The angels of the Lord stood with this saint and served him until he completed his seeking. All the races that believed in our Lord, Jesus Christ, celebrate with him on the day of his commemoration. The faithful peoples gather to the church and glorify our Savior and his pure martyr. Let us gather my beloved with joy and gladness and happily celebrate this strong struggler. Hail to the luminous star, which rose from the East at the time of dawn, thus the rays of his light filled the face of the whole world. Truly, blessed are you, St.Â Proconius, for you cast down the temporal and thus received the eternal. You received many honors from Christ whom you loved, and rejoiced with the saints in the heavenly Jerusalem.

When the council convened in Ephesus, against Nestorius, that madman, enemy of the Virgin, our saintly father, the great Abba Cyril, attended. This saint was with him serving him and his bishops. Text.Language: We the Christian people gained a great boon today, before the Lord God, through the intercessions of our lady, the lady of us all and the pride of our race, Mary the Virgin, in whose church we gather today because of great joy in this revered celebration, in the holy commemoration of this martyr, bride of Christ, St.Â Marina, who fought the good fight and stood before the kings and confessed openly (saying): "IÂ am Christian, I believe in Christ, and IÂ am ready to receive the travails and tortures in His holy name so that I may receive everlasting life with Christ my God in His kingdom." When the oppressor Protos heard her, he ordered that she be tortured. He tortured her with every kind (of torture), but the martyrâ€™s faith did not shake, and she, St.Â Marina the strong believer, did not fear his violence nor his tortures. Truly, Theophimos informed us of the wonders that were made manifest through her hands and how the demons obeyed her; particularly, that her name is written in heaven. He informed us also that Decius is the name of her father, who is from the city of Antioch. Listen to our teacher of the aromatic tongue, Paul the Apostle saying thus: "Those who love God, He empowers in all good deeds." When this saint meditated upon this chapter, and the wicked world, full of evil, she rose with earnestness and struggled in the field of martyrdom, during the reign of Diocletian the hypocrite king, with great patience and steadfast hope, with joy and with gladness and strength of faith in Christ our King, glory to Him forever. She received the crown of martyrdom, and departed to the heavenly repose, with both the martyrs and the saints, in the everlasting Paradise that does not pass.

Come together all of you today, orthodox people, lovers of God, to glorify Jesus Christ, the true Word of the Father, who well blessed us with this pure girl, the wise, the elect, the martyr and true saint, Marina, she who became a fortress for us to repel our enemies, our adversaries, through her intercessions on our behalf. For this, come all of you to say with one mouth: Hail to you Marina, who has a favor before the Lord. Hail to you Marina, the saint and martyr, because of your purity and your martyrdom. Hail to you Marina for you endured severe travails in the holy name of salvation, of our Lord Jesus Christ. Hail to you Marina, the handsome and revered one. You deserved this great glory and this honorable commemoration. Hail to you Marina and to your pure body, the Lord kept it for us and it did not spoil, so that it might become a solace and hope for us and for those who come to it from the countries of the whole earth. For you struggled well in the field of martyrdom and vanquished Satan with the power of Jesus Christ. Thus, He gave her crowns for her true virginity and rejection of the entire world and martyrdom for it. Let us honor her and say hail to the one who inherited the kingdom that does not pass, in the region of the living.

Rejoice, our father Joseph, for you completed the toils, and go to the places of repose, in the kingdom of heaven. Instantly, he was in shock, for fear of death. Our Savior, strengthened and consoled him, saying thus: "Steady your heart and do not fear, Joseph, who brought me up in the flesh, for your death is not a death, but everlasting life. Behold the heavenly powers all come out to meet you, and singing before you as they take you up to the heights of heaven. The garment of the cherubim, I put upon you, so that you might be in their likeness in the ineffable light. Hail to you, Joseph the righteous elder, whose heart is heavenly, friend of the archangels, in the economy of the incarnation and (God) becoming man." You, god-loving soul, rose up high with honor, with the angels, the righteous and the prophets before it. All you nations of the earth celebrate our father Joseph, on the day of his repose, the twenty-sixth day of the month of Epep.
